intro: Hirtella hevanda, commonly known as the velvetleaf hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. Hirtella hevanda is often found in moist, shaded habitats within rainforests.
